def_cn: 说;讲
def_en: When you say something, you speak words.

def_cn: (表达观点或陈述事实，否定用法表示婉转暗示某事并非事实)说，表示
def_en: You use say in expressions such as I would just like to say to introduce what you are actually saying, or to indicate that you are expressing an opinion or admitting a fact. If you state that you can't say something or you wouldn't say something, you are indicating in a polite or indirect way that it is not the case.

def_cn: 告知;宣称;表明
def_en: You can mention the contents of a piece of writing by mentioning what it says or what someone says in it.

def_cn: (自己)想，琢磨;自忖
def_en: If you say something to yourself, you think it.

def_cn: 发言权;决定权
def_en: If you have a say in something, you have the right to give your opinion and influence decisions relating to it.

def_cn: (钟、刻度盘、地图等)表明，指向，显示
def_en: You indicate the information given by something such as a clock, dial, or map by mentioning what it says .

def_cn: 说明;表明;表示
def_en: If something says something about a person, situation, or thing, it gives important information about them.

def_cn: 说明，表示(…有很多优点)
def_en: If something says a lot for a person or thing, it shows that this person or thing is very good or has a lot of good qualities.

def_cn: (通常表示说话者认为某人优点不多)我会这样形容他们/你可以这样形容他们
def_en: You use say in expressions such as I'll say that for them and you can say this for them after or before you mention a good quality that someone has, usually when you think they do not have many good qualities.

def_cn: 假定;假设
def_en: You can use say when you want to discuss something that might possibly happen or be true.

def_cn: 比如说;比方说
def_en: You can use say or let's say when you mention something as an example.

def_cn: (用以唤起注意或表示惊讶、高兴、崇敬)嘿，喂，哎呀，啊
def_en: Say is used to attract someone's attention or to express surprise, pleasure, or admiration.

def_cn: 清楚说明事实;明确表达(…的)感觉
def_en: If you say that something says it all, you mean that it shows you very clearly the truth about a situation or someone's feelings.

def_cn: (表示吃惊)不会吧;(亦常表示事实上并不吃惊)我一点也不觉得奇怪，用不着你说也知道
def_en: You can use 'You don't say' to express surprise at what someone has told you. People often use this expression to indicate that in fact they are not surprised.

def_cn: 值得称道之处;优点
def_en: If you say there is a lot to be said for something, you mean you think it has a lot of good qualities or aspects.

def_cn: 寡言少语;不爱说话
def_en: If you say that someone doesn't have much to say for himself or herself, you mean that they are not speaking very much during a conversation.

def_cn: 你有什么好说的;你有什么要辩解的
def_en: If someone asks what you have to say for yourself, they are asking what excuse you have for what you have done.

def_cn: 显而易见;不言而喻;不用说
def_en: If something goes without saying, it is obvious.

def_cn: 发表意见;阐述观点
def_en: When one of the people or groups involved in a discussion has their say, they give their opinion.

def_cn: (用于对很多人不喜欢的人或事物表示赞赏时)随你怎么说,不管你怎么认为
def_en: You use 'Say what you like about someone or something' when you are about to mention one good thing about a person or thing that many people do not like.

def_cn: (尤指乐于接受他人刚刚提出要给予自己的东西)我不反对，我没意见，好哇
def_en: You use 'I wouldn't say no' to indicate that you would like something, especially something that has just been offered to you.

def_cn: (引出语气更重或更极端的描述)即使不说是…,虽不能说…
def_en: You can use not to say when adding a stronger or more extreme description than the one you have just used.

def_cn: 更不用说;何况
def_en: You use to say nothing of when you mention an additional thing which gives even more strength to the point you are making.

def_cn: (用于提醒别人所说话可能会具有冒犯性或令人震惊)可以说
def_en: You use shall I say and shall we say in order to warn someone that what you are about to say may cause offence or be surprising.

def_cn: 亦即;也就是说;换句话说
def_en: You use that is to say or that's to say to indicate that you are about to express the same idea more clearly or precisely.

def_cn: 让你说对了;一点没错;我同意;说得太对了
def_en: You can use 'You can say that again' to express strong agreement with what someone has just said.
to say the least→see: least;  needless to say→see: needless;
